name: Neon Tetra
description: A small and peaceful fish with vibrant blue and red colors.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on flake food, small pellets, and brine shrimp.
tankRequirements: Prefers heavily planted tanks with subdued lighting.
compatibility: Peaceful species, suitable for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer, prefers dim lighting for breeding.
behavior: Active and peaceful, prefers swimming in groups.
nativeHabitat: Streams and tributaries of South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in schools of at least 6-10 for best behavior.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to water changes and fluctuations in pH.

name: Betta
description: Known for its bright colors and flowing fins, Betta fish are often kept alone.
feedingHabits: Carnivore, prefers live or frozen foods like bloodworms and daphnia.
tankRequirements: Can live in small tanks, but prefers a minimum of 5 gallons.
compatibility: Aggressive towards other Betta males, best kept alone or with peaceful tankmates.
breedingInfo: Bubble nest builder; males protect the eggs.
behavior: Territorial, especially males; can be aggressive towards similar-looking fish.
nativeHabitat: Rice paddies and slow-moving streams in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Can be kept in community tanks if properly selected tankmates.
specialConsiderations: Needs access to the water surface to breathe air.

name: Corydoras Catfish
description: Small bottom-dwelling fish that help keep the substrate clean.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on sinking pellets and leftover food.
tankRequirements: Prefers soft substrate and lots of hiding places.
compatibility: Very peaceful and good for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg layers, prefer shallow water for breeding.
behavior: Active bottom-dweller, enjoys being in groups.
nativeHabitat: Streams and small rivers in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in groups of at least 5-6.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to sharp substrate and poor water quality.

name: Angelfish
description: Elegant fish with tall fins, popular in larger community tanks.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys flakes, pellets, and live food.
tankRequirements: Needs a tall tank due to its body shape.
compatibility: Semi-aggressive, especially during breeding.
breedingInfo: Pairs form monogamous relationships and guard eggs.
behavior: Can become territorial, especially when breeding.
nativeHabitat: Slow-moving rivers in the Amazon Basin.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept with fish that are not fin-nippers.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to water quality; frequent changes required.

name: Guppy
description: Small, colorful livebearer that is easy to care for.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on flakes and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Can thrive in small tanks with plants.
compatibility: Peaceful and great for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Livebearer, breeds readily in community tanks.
behavior: Very active, enjoys swimming in groups.
nativeHabitat: Freshwater streams in Central and South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups, and males can be quite vibrant in color.
specialConsiderations: Prolific breeders; population control may be needed.

name: Common Pleco
description: Popular algae-eating fish, known for its sucker mouth.
feedingHabits: Herbivore, feeds on algae and sinking wafers.
tankRequirements: Requires a large tank with plenty of hiding spots.
compatibility: Peaceful, though its size can be intimidating to smaller fish.
size: Up to 24 inches in the wild, 12-18 inches in aquariums.
breedingInfo: Rarely breeds in home aquariums.
behavior: Nocturnal, often hides during the day.
dietaryRestrictions: Requires supplemental algae wafers or vegetables.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and streams in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in large tanks of at least 100 gallons.
specialConsiderations: Can grow extremely large; often outgrows home aquariums and may require rehoming to a large tank.

name: Zebra Danio
description: Hardy, active fish with distinctive horizontal stripes.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on flake food, small live or frozen foods.
tankRequirements: Can thrive in a variety of water conditions.
compatibility: Very peaceful and great for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer, easy to breed in captivity.
behavior: Active swimmers, often darting around the tank.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in India and Bangladesh.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in schools of 6 or more.
specialConsiderations: Very hardy and good for beginners.

name: Oscar
description: Large, aggressive cichlid with a powerful personality.
feedingHabits: Carnivore, prefers live foods, pellets, and fish.
tankRequirements: Requires a spacious tank with strong filtration.
compatibility: Aggressive, best kept alone or with other large fish.
breedingInfo: Pairs may breed in larger tanks; eggs are laid on flat surfaces.
behavior: Territorial, especially when mature.
dietaryRestrictions: Requires a varied diet with high protein content.
nativeHabitat: South American rivers, such as the Amazon Basin.
stockingRecommendations: Needs a minimum of 55 gallons per fish.
specialConsiderations: Grows large; regular tank maintenance is required.

name: Dwarf Gourami
description: A brightly colored fish that adds a pop of color to community tanks.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys flakes, pellets, and live foods like brine shrimp.
tankRequirements: Prefers a well-planted tank with calm waters.
compatibility: Peaceful, but may show aggression towards other gouramis.
breedingInfo: Bubble nest builder; males guard the eggs.
behavior: Generally peaceful, but territorial during breeding.
dietaryRestrictions: Avoid overfeeding to maintain water quality.
nativeHabitat: Slow-moving streams and ponds in India and Bangladesh.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept with other peaceful fish.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to water changes; stable conditions are required.

name: Harlequin Rasbora
description: Small, peaceful fish with a distinct black patch on their bodies.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys flakes, small pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Thrives in well-planted tanks with soft, acidic water.
compatibility: Very peaceful, ideal for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers broad-leafed plants for spawning.
behavior: Active, loves to swim in schools.
nativeHabitat: Slow-moving waters in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of 6 or more for best behavior.
specialConsiderations: Prefers stable, soft water conditions.

name: Cherry Barb
description: A small, red fish that adds vibrant color to any tank.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on flakes, small pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers planted tanks with ample swimming space.
compatibility: Peaceful, good for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers dense plant cover for breeding.
behavior: Active swimmer, especially when kept in groups.
nativeHabitat: Freshwater streams and rivers in Sri Lanka.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in groups of at least 6-8.
specialConsiderations: Males may display brighter colors when competing for mates.

name: Swordtail
description: A livebearer with a distinctive sword-like extension on the male’s tail.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats flakes, pellets, and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Thrives in tanks with both open swimming space and plants.
compatibility: Peaceful, though males may display aggression towards each other.
breedingInfo: Livebearer; frequent breeder, especially in community tanks.
behavior: Active swimmer, enjoys open areas of the tank.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in Central America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep with other peaceful fish; manage male numbers to reduce aggression.
specialConsiderations: Prolific breeder; can quickly populate a tank.

name: Bristlenose Pleco
description: A small algae-eating catfish known for its bristled face.
feedingHabits: Herbivore, feeds on algae and sinking wafers.
tankRequirements: Prefers a tank with driftwood and hiding spots.
compatibility: Peaceful, suitable for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Cave spawner; prefers hiding spots for breeding.
behavior: Nocturnal; hides during the day and becomes active at night.
dietaryRestrictions: Needs vegetable matter and algae supplementation.
nativeHabitat: Amazon River Basin, South America.
stockingRecommendations: One per tank, as they can be territorial with other Plecos.
specialConsiderations: Helps keep algae levels under control.

name: Pearl Gourami
description: A peaceful, beautifully patterned fish with a pearly appearance.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys flakes, pellets, and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Needs a well-planted tank with floating plants for cover.
compatibility: Generally peaceful, can be kept with other non-aggressive fish.
breedingInfo: Bubble nest builder; males can be territorial during breeding.
behavior: Active but calm; prefers swimming among plants.
nativeHabitat: Slow-moving waters in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in pairs or with other peaceful species.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to poor water quality; regular maintenance is required.

name: Bolivian Ram
description: A small, peaceful cichlid with a beautiful pattern and color.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats flakes, pellets, and small live or frozen foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a well-planted tank with sandy substrate.
compatibility: Peaceful, suitable for community tanks with similar-sized species.
breedingInfo: Egg layer; forms monogamous pairs during breeding.
behavior: Peaceful but territorial during breeding.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and floodplains in Bolivia and Brazil.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in pairs or small groups.
specialConsiderations: Requires stable water parameters for best health.

name: Rummy Nose Tetra
description: A small, schooling fish known for its bright red nose and striped tail.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, prefers flakes, micro-pellets, and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers soft, acidic water and a well-planted environment.
compatibility: Very peaceful, ideal for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers subdued lighting for breeding.
behavior: Active swimmer; thrives when kept in large groups.
nativeHabitat: Blackwater streams of the Amazon River.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in schools of at least 8-10.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to changes in water parameters; stable conditions are crucial.

name: Rainbowfish
description: Colorful fish that are peaceful and active swimmers.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on flakes, pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Requires a spacious tank with open swimming areas.
compatibility: Very peaceful, suitable for larger community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers fine-leaved plants for breeding.
behavior: Active swimmer, especially during feeding times.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and streams in Australia and New Guinea.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in schools for best coloration and behavior.
specialConsiderations: Requires a large tank with clean, well-filtered water.

name: Black Skirt Tetra
description: A hardy, easy-to-care-for fish with a black, flowing skirt-like tail.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys flake food, small pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers planted tanks with open swimming spaces.
compatibility: Peaceful, suitable for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers fine-leaved plants for spawning.
behavior: Active, social fish that prefer to be in groups.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of 6 or more for best behavior.
specialConsiderations: Can nip fins of slow-moving or long-finned fish.

name: Electric Blue Acara
description: A striking fish with electric blue scales and a peaceful temperament.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats flakes, pellets, and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a well-planted tank with sandy substrate.
compatibility: Generally peaceful, can be kept with other similarly sized fish.
breedingInfo: Pairs form and lay eggs on flat surfaces.
behavior: Active, enjoys digging in substrate and exploring.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and lakes in Central and South America.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept with other semi-aggressive fish of similar size.
specialConsiderations: Needs space to explore and hide, especially when breeding.

name: Kuhli Loach
description: A slender, eel-like fish that scavenges along the tank bottom.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on sinking pellets and leftover food.
tankRequirements: Needs a soft substrate and plenty of hiding spots.
compatibility: Very peaceful, ideal for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Rarely breeds in home aquariums; lays eggs on the surface of leaves.
behavior: Nocturnal; hides during the day and becomes active at night.
nativeHabitat: Slow-moving streams in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of 4 or more for best behavior.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to poor water quality; needs stable conditions.

name: Golden Wonder Killifish
description: A surface-dwelling fish with a metallic gold sheen and a peaceful demeanor.
feedingHabits: Carnivore, prefers live and frozen foods like mosquito larvae.
tankRequirements: Requires floating plants and open swimming areas.
compatibility: Semi-aggressive; may eat smaller tank mates.
breedingInfo: Egg layer; eggs are deposited on floating plants.
behavior: Active surface swimmer, often seen hunting for food.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and lakes in Africa.
stockingRecommendations: Avoid keeping with very small fish or fry.
specialConsiderations: Jumpers; tank must have a tight-fitting lid.

name: Clown Loach
description: A colorful and playful fish with bold orange and black stripes.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys sinking pellets and live foods.
tankRequirements: Needs a large tank with plenty of hiding spots and open swimming space.
compatibility: Peaceful but can grow very large, so best kept with larger species.
breedingInfo: Rarely breeds in home aquariums.
behavior: Active, enjoys digging and exploring.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and streams in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of 3 or more.
specialConsiderations: Can grow quite large; requires a big tank.

name: Rainbow Shark
description: A semi-aggressive fish with a sleek black body and red fins.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats algae wafers, pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a tank with caves and hiding spots.
compatibility: Can be territorial; best kept with fast-swimming tank mates.
breedingInfo: Rarely breeds in home aquariums.
behavior: Active bottom swimmer; becomes territorial as it matures.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and streams in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept as a single specimen in smaller tanks.
specialConsiderations: Territorial; needs plenty of space and hiding places.

name: Platy
description: A hardy livebearer with a variety of colors and patterns.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats flakes, small pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Can thrive in small to medium-sized tanks with plants.
compatibility: Peaceful and great for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Livebearer; frequently breeds in home tanks.
behavior: Active and friendly, enjoys swimming in groups.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in Central America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups; females may outnumber males.
specialConsiderations: Can breed prolifically; population control may be needed.

name: Blue Acara
description: A small, vibrant cichlid that is peaceful compared to other cichlids.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, prefers flakes, pellets, and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a sandy substrate and a well-planted environment.
compatibility: Semi-aggressive; can be kept with other cichlids of similar size.
breedingInfo: Pairs form monogamous relationships and lay eggs on flat surfaces.
behavior: Peaceful, but territorial during breeding.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and streams in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in pairs or with other peaceful cichlids.
specialConsiderations: Can be territorial during breeding, so tank mates should be chosen carefully.

name: Siamese Algae Eater
description: A great algae-eating fish that helps keep tanks clean.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys algae wafers and plant matter.
tankRequirements: Prefers a tank with hiding places and open swimming areas.
compatibility: Very peaceful, ideal for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Rarely breeds in home aquariums.
behavior: Active swimmer, often seen grazing on algae.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in Southeast Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept alone or in small groups.
specialConsiderations: Effective algae eater; requires a consistent diet of plant matter.

name: Rosy Barb
description: A robust, active fish with a beautiful pinkish-red coloration.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, feeds on flakes, small pellets, and live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a well-planted tank with open swimming space.
compatibility: Peaceful, suitable for community tanks, but may nip fins.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers dense plant cover for breeding.
behavior: Active swimmer, often found darting through plants.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in South Asia.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in groups of 5 or more.
specialConsiderations: Can nip fins of long-finned fish like guppies.

name: German Blue Ram
description: A small, vibrant cichlid known for its bright blue coloration and peaceful nature.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, prefers flakes, pellets, and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a well-planted tank with sandy substrate.
compatibility: Generally peaceful, best kept with other small, peaceful fish.
breedingInfo: Pairs form and lay eggs on flat surfaces.
behavior: Peaceful but territorial during breeding.
nativeHabitat: Floodplains and streams in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in pairs or with other small peaceful fish.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to water quality; requires stable, warm conditions.

name: Buenos Aires Tetra
description: A hardy tetra species with silver and red coloration.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys flakes, pellets, and live or frozen foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a planted tank with ample open space for swimming.
compatibility: Can be semi-aggressive; suitable for larger community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers plants for egg-laying.
behavior: Active swimmer; may nip fins of slower-moving fish.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and streams in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in schools of 6 or more.
specialConsiderations: Can be fin-nippy, so avoid keeping with delicate species.

name: Panda Corydoras
description: A small bottom-dwelling fish with a black-and-white pattern similar to a panda.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats sinking pellets and leftover food.
tankRequirements: Prefers soft substrate and well-planted tanks.
compatibility: Very peaceful, ideal for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg layers; prefers cool water changes to stimulate breeding.
behavior: Social and active, enjoys being in groups.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of 4 or more.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to sharp substrates and poor water quality.

name: Celestial Pearl Danio
description: A tiny, brightly colored fish with orange and blue speckling.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, enjoys micro-pellets and small live foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers well-planted tanks with calm waters.
compatibility: Very peaceful, perfect for nano tanks and small community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers dense plant cover for breeding.
behavior: Active swimmer; loves to explore.
nativeHabitat: Small lakes in Myanmar.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of at least 8 for best behavior.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to sudden changes in water conditions.

name: Ember Tetra
description: A tiny, fiery orange fish that adds a warm glow to planted tanks.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats micro-pellets and flake foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers heavily planted tanks with soft water.
compatibility: Very peaceful, ideal for nano or community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; breeding occurs in dense vegetation.
behavior: Active and social, thrives in groups.
nativeHabitat: Streams and small rivers in Brazil.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in schools of 6 or more for best coloration.
specialConsiderations: Prefers stable, soft water conditions.

name: Silver Dollar
description: A silver, disk-shaped fish that grows fairly large, ideal for spacious tanks.
feedingHabits: Herbivore, enjoys algae wafers, vegetables, and plant matter.
tankRequirements: Needs a spacious tank with ample swimming space.
compatibility: Peaceful, but can nibble on plants; best with larger tank mates.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; needs dense vegetation for egg laying.
behavior: Active swimmer, prefers open spaces.
dietaryRestrictions: Avoid protein-rich foods; prefers plant matter.
nativeHabitat: Rivers and lakes in South America.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in groups of 4 or more for best behavior.
specialConsiderations: Will eat soft plants; may need fake or hardy plants in the tank.

name: Boesemani Rainbowfish
description: A colorful, medium-sized fish with a vibrant blue and orange body.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats flakes, pellets, and small live or frozen foods.
tankRequirements: Requires a spacious tank with open swimming areas and some plants.
compatibility: Very peaceful, suitable for community tanks.
breedingInfo: Egg scatterer; prefers fine-leaved plants for breeding.
behavior: Active swimmer, enjoys being in groups.
nativeHabitat: Lakes and rivers in Papua New Guinea.
stockingRecommendations: Keep in schools of 6 or more for best color display.
specialConsiderations: Sensitive to poor water quality; requires clean water conditions.

name: Rainbow Kribensis
description: A small, colorful cichlid with a peaceful temperament.
feedingHabits: Omnivore, eats flakes, pellets, and live or frozen foods.
tankRequirements: Prefers a well-planted tank with caves for hiding.
compatibility: Generally peaceful; can be territorial during breeding.
breedingInfo: Cave spawner; males guard eggs and fry.
behavior: Active and curious, enjoys exploring.
nativeHabitat: Streams and rivers in West Africa.
stockingRecommendations: Best kept in pairs or small groups.
specialConsiderations: Territorial during breeding; provide plenty of hiding spots.
